Organize a cultural exchange event: Hosting a foreign exchange student can be a great opportunity to learn about different cultures and traditions. To make the most of this experience, you could organize a cultural exchange event where your exchange student can share their culture with other students in your school or community. This could include food, music, dance, and other cultural activities. Confidence score: 0.8

Create a personalized welcome package: To make your exchange student feel welcome, you could create a personalized welcome package that includes items such as a map of the area, local treats, and a list of recommended places to visit. This will help your exchange student feelzum and at home in their new environment. Confidence score: 0.9

Plan a weekend trip: If you have some free time during your exchange student's stay, you could plan a weekend trip to a nearby city or tourist attraction. This will give your exchange student a chance to see more of the country and experience new things. Confidence score: 0.7

Help your exchange student improve their English: If your exchange student is not fluent in English, you could offer to help them improve their language skills. This could include practicing speaking and listening, reading and writing, and watching English-language movies and TV shows. Confidence score: 0.8

Plan a language exchange: To help your exchange student improve their English and learn more about your culture, you could plan a language exchange with a native English speaker.
